About.title: About Setwise
About.intro: Setwise is an app for lifters who want to log their workouts smarter – not just "weight × reps".

focus.title: We focus on:
focus.content:
• advanced set logging (RIR/RPE, tempo, range of motion, intensifiers)
• clear progress analytics over time
• reliable performance even when the signal at the gym is poor.

developer.title: Independent Development
developer.content: Setwise is being developed as an independent project by Jernej Peternel – an enthusiast of strength training and mobile app development.

goal.title: The app's goal is simple:
goal.content: less time typing on your phone, more focus on training.

Contact.title: Contact Us
Contact.intro: Have questions or feedback? We'd love to hear from you.

general.title: General Inquiries
general.content: For general questions about SetWise, partnerships, or press inquiries.

team.title: Reach the Team
team.content: Contact our founders directly for collaboration or technical questions.

support.title: Support
support.content: Need help with the app? Check our guides or reach out to the support team.

jernej.title: Jernej Peternel
jernej.content: Passionate about strength training and building great software.

ozbolt.title: Ožbolt Klemenčič
ozbolt.content: Focused on creating intuitive user experiences and scalable solutions.

TermsOfUse.title: Terms of Use
TermsOfUse.intro:
These terms of use govern the use of the website setwise.app and the mobile application Setwise.

By using the website, signing up for the waitlist, or creating an account in the app, you confirm that you agree to these terms.

whoIsBehind.title: 1. Who is Behind Setwise
whoIsBehind.content:
Setwise is operated by:

Jernej Peternel — Founder & Developer
jernej.peternel@setwise.app

Ožbolt Klemenčič — Co-Founder & Developer
ozbolt.klemencic@setwise.app

purpose.title: 2. Purpose of the App
purpose.content:
Setwise is an app for logging workouts and basic progress analytics.

The app does not constitute health advice and does not replace consultation with a doctor, physiotherapist, or exercise specialist. All workouts are performed at your own risk.

beta.title: 3. Beta Version
beta.content:
Setwise is currently in beta phase. This means that:

• errors may occur, some features may not work, or data may be lost
• features may change or be removed
• we may change or terminate access to the app or parts of the app at any time

We cannot accept responsibility for data loss or other consequences related to the use of the beta version, except to the extent expressly required by applicable law.

accountUsage.title: 4. Account Usage
accountUsage.content:
As a user, you agree to:

• provide accurate basic information where required
• protect your account access and not share it with others
• use the app in accordance with applicable law and these terms

We may limit or terminate your account or access to the app if you:

• use the app in a way that harms us or other users
• attempt to exploit security vulnerabilities
• violate applicable law or these terms of use

content.title: 5. Content You Enter into the App
content.content:
All data you enter into the app (e.g., workouts, exercises, sets, weights, notes) remain your data.

By entering them, you give us permission to process them as part of the app's operation, including:

• storage and backups
• display within the app (e.g., statistics, analytics)
• technical processes for maintaining and improving the service

Processing of your data is described in more detail in the Privacy Policy.

aiFeatures.title: 6. AI Features
aiFeatures.content:
Some Setwise features may use artificial intelligence models (e.g., for converting text workout descriptions into a structured plan).

• content you enter into AI features is sent to a selected provider (currently Google AI Studio), which returns the result
• we do not guarantee that results will always be complete, accurate, or suitable for your specific case
• AI results do not constitute professional or health advice

Use of AI features is voluntary – if you don't want to use them, simply don't use them.

liability.title: 7. Limitation of Liability
liability.content:
We strive to keep the app as stable as possible, however:

• we do not guarantee that the app will always be available or error-free
• we do not guarantee that all data will always be correctly saved or synchronized
• we are not liable for indirect damages (e.g., lost workout data, lost progress, disruptions in app use), except where expressly required by law

You are always responsible for your own training, choice of weights, techniques, and training frequency.

privacyConnection.title: 8. Connection to Privacy Policy
privacyConnection.content:
These terms of use are closely linked to our Privacy Policy, which describes how we process your personal data.

Both documents are available at:
setwise.app/terms
setwise.app/privacy

By using the app, you confirm that you have familiarized yourself with both documents.

changes.title: 9. Changes to Terms
changes.content:
We may update these terms of use from time to time. The updated version will always be published at setwise.app/terms with the date of the last update.

If there are significant changes, we will try to notify you through the app or email (if appropriate).

contact.title: 10. Contact
contact.content:
For questions regarding these terms of use, you can contact:

Jernej Peternel
Email: jernej.peternel@setwise.app

Ožbolt Klemenčič
Email: ozbolt.klemencic@setwise.app

General: info@setwise.app

PrivacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPolicy.intro: Your privacy is important to us. It is SetWise's policy to respect your privacy regarding any information we may collect from you across our website and applications.

overview.title: 1. Overview
overview.content: We only ask for personal information when we truly need it to provide a service to you. We collect it by fair and lawful means, with your knowledge and consent.

dataCollection.title: 2. Data Collection
dataCollection.content: We may collect information about you in a variety of ways. The information we may collect on the App includes: Personal Data and Derivative Data.

usage.title: 3. Use of Your Information
usage.content: Having accurate information about you permits us to provide you with a smooth, efficient, and customized experience. Specifically, we use information collected about you via the App to create and manage your account.

dataProtection.title: 4. Data Protection
dataProtection.content: We use administrative, technical, and physical security measures to help protect your personal information. While we have taken reasonable steps to secure the personal information you provide to us, please be aware that despite our efforts, no security measures are perfect or impenetrable.

Cookies.title: Cookie Policy
Cookies.intro: This Cookie Policy explains how SetWise uses cookies and similar technologies to recognize you when you visit our website.

whatAreCookies.title: 1. What are cookies?
whatAreCookies.content: Cookies are small data files that are placed on your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. Cookies are widely used by website owners in order to make their websites work, or to work more efficiently, as well as to provide reporting information.

howWeUse.title: 2. How we use cookies
howWeUse.content: We use cookies for several reasons. Some cookies are required for technical reasons in order for our Website to operate, and we refer to these as 'essential' or 'strictly necessary' cookies.

managingCookies.title: 3. Managing cookies
managingCookies.content: You have the right to decide whether to accept or reject cookies. You can exercise your cookie rights by setting your preferences in the Cookie Consent Manager.

Metadata.title: SetWise – Workout Tracker for Serious Lifters
Metadata.description: Log workouts in seconds, track strength progress with clear analytics, and build training programs. SetWise is the offline-first advanced workout tracker for iOS & Android.
Metadata.keywords: workout tracker, fitness app, workout logging, progress tracking, strength training, gym app, exercise tracker, workout planner, training log, SetWise, offline workout app, RPE tracker
Metadata.ogDescription: The workout tracker built for serious lifters. Fast set logging, progress analytics, workout templates, and offline mode. Free on iOS & Android.

hero.subtitle: SetWise is the ultimate workout tracker for serious lifters. Build routines, track progress, and reach your goals with AI-powered insights.

feature1.title: Train with precision.
feature1.description: If you track progress by feel, you’ll miss it more often than you think. SetWise visualizes every lift by exercise, from volume to top sets, so progress is obvious.

feature2.title: From
feature2.description: Already have a plan in a PDF or your notes? Just paste it. SetWise converts it into a clean, structured program you can start logging right away.

feature3.title: Built to
feature3.description: Fewer taps, faster logging. SetWise keeps everything you need on one screen, so you don’t break your training flow.

BentoGrid.title: Plan less. Execute more.
BentoGrid.subtitle: Spot improvements, plateaus, and next steps instantly. Progress becomes obvious. Make smarter decisions after every session.

trackAnalyze.title: Track. Analyze. Improve.
trackAnalyze.description: Turn workout data into progress. You can see your progress in real-time on graphs.

offline.title: No internet. No excuses.
offline.description: Track sessions, sets, and timers offline - everything saves automatically.

details.title: Details drive progress
details.description: Reps and weight don't tell the full story. Capture tempo, ROM, and intensifiers with quick notes, and turn every session into actionable progress.

progress.title: Progress Overview
progress.description: See trends, spot patterns, and push past plateaus. Every rep counts, every set matters.

Testimonials.headline: Loved by
Testimonials.headlineRest: serious lifters. Proven in real training.
Testimonials.description: SetWise is built for people who take training seriously. See what users say saved them the most time and helped them keep progressing.

reviews.name: Liam Fabiani
reviews.reviewText: The app gives you a lot of customizability despite its early access and I'd love to see where the developers take it from here...

reviews.name: Liam Fabiani
reviews.reviewText: The app gives you a lot of customizability despite its early access and I'd love to see where the developers take it from here...

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.subtitle: Explore your data, build your dashboard, bring your team together.

items.question: What analytics does SetWise provide?
items.answer: Progress charts and filters per exercise and time range, so you can visualize strength trends, consistency, and performance changes at a glance.

items.question: How is my data stored?
items.answer: Your data is encrypted at rest and in transit. We believe your workout data belongs to you, so we offer full JSON/CSV exports at any time.

items.question: Is SetWise fast to use during a workout?
items.answer: Yes - logging is designed for speed. Most sets take seconds to record, with advanced options (RPE/RIR, tempo, notes) available when you need them.

items.question: Can it handle my training style (strength, bodybuilding, powerbuilding)?
items.answer: Yes. It supports straight sets, supersets, and advanced set types (e.g., drop sets, rest-pause, myo-reps), so it fits most programs.

items.question: How does 'Paste Import' work - and what formats does it understand?
items.answer: Paste any workout as plain text (from Notes, WhatsApp, Excel, or copied text). SetWise uses LLM-powered parsing to recognize exercises, sets, reps, and common set types - then converts it into a clean, structured workout you can log instantly. It's designed to handle different writing styles and messy formatting.

items.question: Will this feel too advanced or complicated?
items.answer: No. SetWise adapts to your style - keep it simple with weight/reps only, or toggle Advanced Tracking when you want details like RPE / RIR, tempo, ROM, and intensifiers.

items.question: Can I see progress per exercise (not just overall)?
items.answer: Yes - analytics are exercise-level, with filters for time ranges and key metrics so you can zoom in on any lift.

items.question: Does it work offline in the gym?
items.answer: Yes. You can log offline and sync later when you're back online.

FAQPage.heading: Answers to your <primary>questions</primary>
FAQPage.description: Everything important in one place. No hidden accordion content, just clear answers you can skim quickly.

installIos.question: How do I install SetWise on iPhone?
installIos.answer: Open the app URL in Safari, tap Share, then choose 'Add to Home Screen'. This gives you a full-screen app icon and faster access.

installAndroid.question: How do I install SetWise on Android?
installAndroid.answer: Open the app URL in Chrome, tap the three-dot menu, then choose 'Install App' (or 'Add to Home Screen' on some devices).

guideFirstWorkout.question: Where should I start if I am new to SetWise?
guideFirstWorkout.answer: Start with the installation guide, then follow the 'Create Workout' guide. You can begin with a simple routine and add advanced tracking later.

guidePasteImport.question: Can I import a workout from notes or messages?
guidePasteImport.answer: Yes. Use Paste Import to convert plain text plans into structured workouts. The parser understands most common lifting formats.

featuresOffline.question: Does SetWise work without internet in the gym?
featuresOffline.answer: Yes. SetWise is offline-first. You can log workouts without signal and sync when your connection is available again.

featuresAnalytics.question: What analytics can I track in SetWise?
featuresAnalytics.answer: You can track volume trends, estimated strength progress, and exercise history with practical filters for date range and performance.

featuresAdvanced.question: Can I log advanced set details like RPE or tempo?
featuresAdvanced.answer: Yes. You can keep logging simple or add advanced fields like RPE/RIR, tempo, notes, and other workout context when needed.

accountBeta.question: Do I need an account to use the app?
accountBeta.answer: Core usage is focused on fast start and practical logging. Account-related flows are available where needed for sync, updates, and beta access.

accountData.question: Can I export my workout data?
accountData.answer: Yes. SetWise supports data export so you can keep control of your training history and backup your progress.

CommunityPage.heading: Join the <primary>SetWise</primary> community

SplitBlue.headline: Built by
SplitBlue.description: SetWise was born out of countless real workouts and one simple goal: make logging effortless. If you train seriously, you want speed, clarity, and zero distraction. So everything is built around your flow between sets.

Footer.description: Your goals, simplified. Train, track, and level up with SetWise.

NotFound.title: Page not found
NotFound.description: The page you're looking for doesn't exist or has been moved.

FeaturesPage.title: Features
FeaturesPage.description: Discover all the powerful features SetWise offers to help you reach your fitness goals.
FeaturesPage.heading: Intro
FeaturesPage.subHeading: Everything you need in the <brand>SetWise</brand> app

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: SetWise is an iOS and Android workout tracker built for lifters who want to log fast and understand progress at a glance. Track every set, keep your full training history in one place, and see the numbers that matter, without getting in the way of your workout. SetWise works offline by default, with optional sync when you want it.

fast.title: Fast logging
fast.description: Log a set in seconds - weight, reps, done. Less time on your phone between sets.

offline.title: Offline-first
offline.description: No signal required. Your workouts are saved on your device and stay available in the gym.

compare.title: Auto-compare
compare.description: See your last performance and bests next to each exercise, so you always know what to beat.

analytics.title: Analytics that stay clear
analytics.description: Track volume, strength estimates, and training consistency with clean, readable charts.

liveSession.text: keeps you on one screen while you train. Add sets fast, check history and PRs per exercise.

historyPrs.text: For every exercise, see recent performance and personal records right where you log.

myTemplates.text: are your saved workouts - build a session once, then reuse it anytime with all exercises ready to go.

publicPrograms.text: Programs organize your training week into a split (e.g. Push/Pull/Legs). Inside each program, you’ll find your workout templates for each day - ready to repeat, track, and improve over time.

workoutLog.text: keeps every session with date, duration, and key stats for quick review.

personalRecords.text: are detected automatically (volume PR, total weight PR) so you can spot progress instantly.

calendarView.text: gives you a simple monthly overview of training frequency and workload.

volumeCharts.text: show workload over time, per workout and per exercise.

strengthEstimates.text: help you track performance trends without guessing.

visualWeb.text: make it easy to compare sessions and see what’s improving at a glance.

rpeTracking.text: lets you record effort and manage intensity week to week.

dropSupersets.title: Intensifiers
dropSupersets.description: Drop sets, rest-pause, cluster sets and more - track advanced set styles while the app keeps the session structured.

autoCompare.title: Auto-Compare
autoCompare.description: See last time and bests during a live session so you always know what to beat.

rpeTempoRom.title: RPE / RIR, Tempo & ROM
rpeTempoRom.description: Log effort, tempo, and range of motion per set to capture training quality and not just numbers.

setNotes.title: Set Notes
setNotes.description: Add notes on the set level for cues, form feedback, pain flags, or anything you want to remember next time.

beta.title: Beta Access
beta.description: SetWise is currently in closed beta. Join to get early access and help shape the product with direct feedback.

step1.title: Choose a Program Day
step1.description: Start from a program day (template) or open an empty session.

step2.title: Add Exercises
step2.description: Add movements and instantly see your last session and personal bests.

step3.title: Log Sets
step3.description: Enter weight and reps, tap ✓, and keep lifting - SetWise handles the flow between sets.

localStorage.title: Data stays on your device
localStorage.description: Your workouts are stored locally by default.

encryption.title: Secure sync (when enabled)
encryption.description: If you turn on sync, data is transmitted securely and stored encrypted.

FeaturesSidebar.betaDescription: Download the app and track your progress with precision.

templates.title: Templates & Programs
templates.heading: Templates & Programs
templates.subHeading: Build your training structure once, then repeat it with confidence. Programs act as your split, and each program contains templates for your training days—so logging stays fast and progress stays consistent.

importPlan.title: Import a Plan (Parser)
importPlan.description: Already have a training plan written in notes, a message, or a document? Paste it in and SetWise will parse it into a structured program with days, exercises, and sets. We built this because creating plans manually can take 20–30 minutes - now it takes a fraction of that, so “setting up a plan” doesn’t have to be an excuse anymore.

createNew.title: Create New
createNew.description: Create your own split from scratch. Add training days as templates, set up exercises, and make a structure you can repeat week after week.

progressAnalytics.title: Progress & Analytics
progressAnalytics.heading: Progress & Analytics
progressAnalytics.subHeading: See your training at a glance - how often you train, what you’ve been doing, and how your performance is moving over time. SetWise combines a clean calendar view with workout summaries and exercise-level comparisons, so progress is easy to understand.

progress.title: Progress
progress.description: A calendar view of your workouts, plus a weekly snapshot with active days and average training frequency - so you can track consistency, not just single sessions.

workoutDetails.title: Workout Details
workoutDetails.description: Open any past workout to see a clear summary: total volume, duration, and key highlights like new PRs, your heaviest set, and biggest improvements.

exercisesSets.title: Exercises & Sets
exercisesSets.description: Review every exercise and set from the session - including notes - with automatic comparisons to your previous workout so you can instantly see changes in reps and weight.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.description: Turn your workouts into clear trends. SetWise keeps charts simple and useful - so you can spot progress without digging through numbers.

volumeChart.title: Workout Volume Chart
volumeChart.description: See total volume for the session and compare it in context: against workouts from the same template (to track how a specific day is progressing), or against all workouts (to see where this session sits overall).

exerciseChart.title: Exercise Progress Chart
exerciseChart.description: Track an exercise across time to see how performance evolves. Compare sessions and quickly spot whether you’re moving more weight, getting more reps, or trending in the right direction.

advancedMetrics.title: Advanced Metrics
advancedMetrics.heading: Advanced Metrics
advancedMetrics.subHeading: Progress isn’t just weight and reps. The same numbers can feel completely different if you change tempo, range of motion, or effort. SetWise lets you track these details per set - so your progress stays honest, comparable, and repeatable.

optionalNote.title: Optional for advanced users
optionalNote.description: Advanced Metrics can be enabled in Settings, so you can keep logging simple - or turn on deeper tracking when you want it.

rpeRir.title: RPE / RIR
rpeRir.description: Log effort per set to track intensity over time. It helps you compare sessions more accurately than weight and reps alone.

tempoRom.title: Tempo & ROM
tempoRom.description: Set tempo and range of motion per set, so you can keep form and execution consistent - and avoid “fake progress” from shorter reps or faster tempo.

intensifiers.title: Intensifiers
intensifiers.description: Track advanced set styles like drop sets and supersets while keeping your workout history clear and comparable.

offlineSync.title: Offline-first & Sync
offlineSync.heading: Offline-first & Sync
offlineSync.subHeading: SetWise is designed to stay reliable in the gym. Core workout logging works without depending on a connection, and sync (when enabled) keeps your data backed up and available across devices.

worksOffline.title: Works offline
worksOffline.description: Log sets, review recent workouts, and keep your session moving - even with no signal.

sync.title: Sync
sync.description: When you’re online, sync keeps your data safe and consistent across devices.

connectionRequired.title: Connection required for
connectionRequired.description: Some features - like multi-device sync, backups - require an internet connection.

QuickLoggingPage.title: Quick Logging
QuickLoggingPage.description: In the gym, focus is everything. SetWise is built to keep you locked in with a fast logging flow - minimal taps, no unnecessary screens, and only what you need between sets.
QuickLoggingPage.heading: Quick Logging

liveSession.title: Live Session
liveSession.description: Log sets as you lift on a single screen. Enter weight and reps, tap <check>✓</check>, and keep moving - everything stays quick and distraction-free.

quickWorkout.title: Quick Workout
quickWorkout.description: No plan today? Start an empty workout and build it as you go. Add exercises on the fly, log sets in seconds, and keep the session moving - perfect for “go with the flow” training.

setNotes.title: Set Notes
setNotes.description: Add notes to any set to capture cues, form feedback, or anything you want to remember for next time.

workoutDuration.title: Workout Duration
workoutDuration.description: SetWise tracks your workout duration from start to finish, so you can review how long sessions take and spot changes over time.

ToolsPage.title: Tools
ToolsPage.description: Useful tools and calculators to optimize your training and nutrition.

ComingSoon.title: Coming Soon
ComingSoon.subtitle: We're working on it
ComingSoon.description: This feature is currently under development. Stay tuned for updates!

Sidebar.betaDescription: Download the app and start your journey.

ProgressPage.title: Progress
ProgressPage.heading: Track your <brand>gains</brand>
ProgressPage.subHeading: See your stats, analyze trends, and visualize your progress over time.

overview.title: Progress Overview
overview.description: The Progress screen gives you a clear overview of your training history and trends. It includes:

list.2: quick weekly stats (workouts, active days, avg duration)

calendar.title: 1) Calendar filter
calendar.description: At the top you’ll find a calendar strip you can swipe left / right.

list.1: Tap a specific day to show workouts from that day
list.2: Days with a workout are marked with a blue dot

calendar.footer: To return to the full list, click the selection (or select another day).
calendar.imageAlt: Calendar strip with blue dot + selected day

history.title: 2) Workout history list
history.description: Each workout is shown as a card with key info like:

list.4: a quick comparison badge vs your last workout from the same template

history.scrollNote: Scroll down to browse older workouts.
history.footer: SetWise loads 20 workouts at a time, and will automatically load more as you reach the end of the list.

details.title: 3) Open workout details
details.description:
Tap any workout card to open the workout detail screen.

Inside the detail screen you’ll find:

tip.title: Tip
tip.description: Use the comparison badge to quickly see whether your session was up or down compared to your last workout from the same template.

intro.text: Tap any workout card in Progress to open the Workout Details screen. At the top you can switch between three tabs:

list.1: Summary - a quick overview of the whole session
list.2: Exercises - every exercise and set, fully broken down

summary.title: 1) Summary tab
summary.description: The Summary tab shows the most important session stats at a glance:

list.1: Total Volume (with a badge comparing to your last workout from the same template)

achievements.title: It also highlights achievements such as:

summary.imageAlt: Summary tab showing volume + badge + achievements + notes

exercises.title: 2) Exercises tab
exercises.description: The Exercises tab shows your full workout log:

list.1: Each exercise includes a quick comparison vs your last workout from the same template
list.2: Volume is shown on the exercise level
list.3: Every set is listed with weight × reps
list.4: Any exercise notes added during the workout are visible here

exercises.note: This is the best tab for reviewing exactly what you did set-by-set.
exercises.imageAlt: Exercises tab with set list + comparisons + notes

analysis.title: 3) Analysis tab

list.1: Volume Trend graph (how your workout volume changes over time)
list.2: Exercise Explorer (pick an exercise and review progress over time)

analysis.imageAlt: Analysis tab showing filters + volume trend + exercise explorer

tip.title: Tip
tip.description: Use Same template when you want the most meaningful comparison (e.g. Upper A vs your previous Upper A).

volumeTrend.title: Analysis (Volume Trend)
volumeTrend.description: The Volume Trend chart shows how your training volume changes over time. It helps you spot consistency, spikes, and whether your recent sessions are trending up or down.

list.1: Each point represents the total volume of a workout
list.2: “Today’s volume” shows the volume of the workout you’re currently viewing
list.3: The % text compares today vs your last relevant workout (based on the selected filter)

compare.title: 2) Compare the right workouts
compare.description: Use the top filter to choose what you want to compare:

list.1: All workouts — broad trend across everything you do
list.2: Same template — compares only workouts from the same template/day (recommended)

compare.note: Same template is usually the most useful view (Upper A vs Upper A, Lower vs Lower).

timeframe.title: 3) Choose the timeframe
timeframe.description: Use the timeframe filter to change the range:

howTo.title: How to use it
howTo.description: If volume is trending down for the same template, it may signal fatigue, lower effort, or a change in exercise selection.

tip.title: Tip
tip.text:
Higher volume doesn’t always mean better progress — volume can increase just by adding more sets.

For a clearer signal, also check <link >exercise explorer</link> (top set, reps, and weight over time).

exerciseExplorer.title: Analysis (Exercise Explorer)
exerciseExplorer.description: Exercise Explorer lets you track progress for a specific exercise over time. It’s the best place to confirm real progress beyond just total volume.

list.3: Use the exercise selector to choose an exercise

whatToTrack.title: 2) What you can track
whatToTrack.description: For the selected exercise you can review trends over time, including:

list.1: Volume (total volume for that exercise per workout)

filters.title: 3) Use the same filters (recommended)
filters.description: For the clearest signal, combine Exercise Explorer with filters:
filters.note: This avoids mixing different variations of the same exercise across different days.

list.1: If Top set is improving, you’re getting stronger on that movement.
list.2: If Reps increase at the same weight, that’s also progress.
list.3: If Volume rises while top set stays flat, it may simply be more sets or accessories.

tip.title: Tip
tip.description: Use exercise notes from your workouts (pain, setup, technique cues) to explain dips or spikes - context matters.

Page.title: Welcome
Page.subtitle: SetWise is built to make training simple, consistent, and measurable.

intro.title: In these guides you’ll learn how to:

list.install: install SetWise on any mobile device

intro.footer: Use the menu on the left to follow step by step, or jump to the topic you need.

howTo.title: How to get the most out of SetWise
howTo.description: SetWise works best when you log consistently and review your progress with intent.

1.title: 1) Use Templates for consistency
1.description: If you follow a split, build a Program and train from Days (Templates). This makes comparisons meaningful (Upper A vs Upper A).

2.title: 2) Start fast with “Last”
2.description: During workouts, SetWise pre-fills values based on your previous session. Use Last as your baseline, then adjust up/down.

3.title: 3) Keep notes short (but useful)
3.footer: This makes your next session smarter.

4.title: 4) Use Quick Start when you need flexibility
4.description: No plan today? Use Quick Start and build the session as you go. You can still track everything and review it in Progress.

list.trends: check volume trends and Exercise Explorer

list.consistency: Consistency beats perfection. A clean log and a quick weekly review is enough to see progress over time.
list.quality: Only count progress if the quality stays the same.
list.form: Keep your form, ROM, and tempo consistent - adding reps/weight by shortening range of motion or changing tempo isn’t real progressive overload (you changed the conditions).

learnMore.title: Learn More
learnMore.contactDesc: Get in touch with the team

InstallationPage.title: Installation
InstallationPage.description: How to install SetWise on your device.
InstallationPage.heading: Install <brand>SetWise</brand> in seconds

ios.title: SetWise for iOS
ios.subtitle: Distributed through TestFlight during Early Access.
ios.description: TestFlight is Apple’s official app for testing beta versions - it lets you install SetWise safely, receive updates, and send feedback, before the public App Store release. Once you get the invite link by email, the setup takes about a minute.

1.title: 1) Request Early Access
1.note: Use the same email you use on your iPhone (recommended), so joining is seamless.

2.title: 2) Check your inbox
2.description: Within a few minutes, you’ll receive an email with a TestFlight invite link.

list.1: If you don’t see it, check Spam / Promotions

3.title: 3) Install TestFlight
3.description: TestFlight is Apple’s official beta testing app.

list.1: On your iPhone, open the invite email

5.title: 5) Open SetWise
5.description: After installation, you can open SetWise:

updates.title: Updates (important)
updates.description: New beta builds are delivered through TestFlight.

list.1: Open TestFlight to see available updates
list.2: Turn on auto-updates if you want the latest build automatically

1.title: I can’t open the invite link

list.1: Make sure you open it on the iPhone (not desktop)
list.2: Try copying the link into Safari

list.1: Double-check the email you entered in the form
list.3: Try again with a different email address

3.title: TestFlight says the beta is full
3.description: Spots are limited. If this happens, request access again later - we expand capacity regularly.

android.title: Android (Google Play)
android.subtitle: Available through Google Play Open Testing.
android.description: After you request Early Access, you’ll get an email with a link that opens the Play Store, where you can install the beta like a normal app.

2.title: 2) Check your inbox
2.description: You’ll receive an email with your Google Play beta link.

list.1: If you don’t see it, check Spam / Promotions

3.title: 3) Open the Play Store link

list.1: Open the email on your Android phone
list.2: Tap the link - it will open Google Play

3.note: If you see a step like Join / Become a tester, confirm it and then install.

updates.title: Updates (important)
updates.description: Beta updates arrive through Google Play.

list.2: Optional: enable Auto-update for SetWise in the Play Store

1.title: The link opens on my computer, not my phone
1.description: Open the email on your Android device (or forward it to an account you use on your phone).

2.title: “This app is not available for your device”
2.description: Your Android version may be too old, or the device isn’t supported for this release. For more info about this check REQUIREMENTS.

list.3: Request access again and double-check the email you entered

requirements.title: REQUIREMENTS

list.1: iPhone or iPad running iOS 15.1 or later

android.title: Android

list.1: Android device with Google Play Store access

android.compatibility: Compatibility note: SetWise is confirmed working on Android 8+. Earlier versions are not officially supported.

list.1: Internet is required for installation, sign-in, template creation, and AI-powered features.
list.2: After setup, core logging works offline

requirements.notCompatible: If Google Play shows “Not compatible”, the device doesn’t meet the current minimum requirements.

CreateWorkoutPage.title: Create Workout
CreateWorkoutPage.description: How to create workouts in SetWise.
CreateWorkoutPage.heading: Create your <brand>perfect</brand> workout

overview.title: Workout Creation
overview.description: SetWise offers flexible ways to create workouts, from simple lists to complex programs.

ai.title: AI Generator
ai.description: Let AI build it for you.

beta.title: Try It Now
beta.description: Create your first workout in seconds.

createProgram.title: Create a Program & Templates
createProgram.subtitle: A Program is your training structure over time.
createProgram.description: Inside a program you create Days (e.g. Upper A, Upper B, Lower), and each day contains your exercises and set details. Templates let you reuse the same day or workout structure anytime.

list.2: Add training days (Upper A / Upper B / …)
list.3: Build each day by adding exercises and setting targets

list.4: Repeat for as many days as you need

3.title: 3) Build a Day (add exercises)
3.subDescription: For each exercise, you can configure:

subList.3: Advanced (optional): intensifiers, ROM, tempo, and other details

4.title: 4) Add notes (per exercise)
4.description: You can add notes on the exercise level (e.g. cues, setup, technique reminders). Notes will stay attached to that exercise in the day and can be changed anytime.

5.title: 5) Edit anytime (non-destructive)
5.description: Programs and days are designed to be flexible:

list.3: Update rep ranges, RPE/RIR, or Advanced settings

5.footer: Everything can be adjusted later from the Edit screen.
5.imageAlt: Edit day / Edit program entry point

search.title: Exercise search (and creating your own)
search.description: When adding an exercise, use the search bar:

list.1: If the exercise exists, select it.
list.2: If it doesn’t exist, just type the name and create it instantly — no extra steps.

search.footer: This makes it easy to log any variation or custom movement.

list.1: Use consistent day naming: Upper A / Upper B / Lower A / Lower B
list.2: Keep RPE/RIR optional - add it only if you actively use it
list.3: Use notes for cues you often forget (setup, tempo, depth, grip)

startTemplate.title: Start from a Template
startTemplate.subtitle: Templates are your planned workouts inside a program (e.g. Upper A, Upper B).
startTemplate.description: They already include your exercises and targets (rep ranges, optional RPE/RIR, etc.).

list.3: Tap the Start icon next to the day name

2.title: 2) What you see during the workout

3.title: 3) Template actions (during the workout)
3.footer: Use these when something changes mid-session.

4.title: 4) Finish the workout
4.description: When you’re done, tap Finish (top right corner). A summary sheet will open where you can:

list.2: optionally add workout notes (for the entire session)

5.title: 5) Resume a workout (if you close the app)
5.description: If you close SetWise by accident or switch apps, your active workout is kept. When you open the app again, you’ll see a prompt on the Programs screen that lets you:

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.subtitle: Quick Start is for flexible training days - you don’t need a fixed plan.
quickStart.description: Start the workout immediately and add exercises as you go.

2.title: 2) Add exercises during the workout

list.2: Search for an exercise and tap to add it

2.subTitle: Create your own exercise (instantly)
2.subDescription:
If you can’t find an exercise:

Type the name and create it instantly - no extra setup required.
2.imageAlt: Add Exercise search + Create new exercise

list.1: Adjust weight/reps using + / − or tap to type
list.3: Use the note icon to add exercise notes (optional)

4.title: 4) Exercise options (⋯)
4.description: Tap the ⋯ menu on an exercise to:

list.1: Remove exercise (if you added it by mistake)
list.3: Finish exercise (mark it as done for a cleaner view)

4.footer: Finishing an exercise helps keep your session organized, especially in longer workouts.

5.title: 5) Finish the workout
5.description: When you’re done, tap Finish (top right corner). A summary sheet will open where you can:

resume.title: Resume a workout
resume.description: If you leave the app mid-workout, SetWise keeps it active. Next time you open the app, you can Continue from the prompt on the Programs screen.

logging.title: Logging sets & notes
logging.subtitle: Logging works the same whether you start from a Template or use Quick Start.

list.2: Tap the value field to type an exact number

2.title: 2) Log a set (✓)
2.description: When the numbers are correct, tap ✓ to log the set. Logged sets appear under Today for that exercise.

3.title: 3) Edit a logged set (pencil)
3.description: If you need to correct something after logging:

4.title: 4) Undo mistakes (Delete last logged set)
4.description: If you log a set by accident, use:
4.subDescription: This removes the most recent set you logged for that exercise.

5.title: 5) Skip a set (Templates)
5.description: When training from a template, you can also Skip a set if needed.

6.title: 6) Add exercise notes (note icon)
6.description: Tap the note icon to add notes on the exercise level, for example:
6.footer: These notes help you remember context next session.

tip.title: Tip: Use “Last” to start fast
tip.description: Fields are pre-filled automatically based on your previous session. Use Last as a quick reference so you immediately know what weight/reps to aim for today.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: SetWise includes AI-powered tools that help you save time. Right now, the main AI feature is Import Plan - paste a workout plan from anywhere and convert it into a structured program with templates (days).

list.1: You already have a plan written in notes / a document
list.2: You got a plan from a coach
list.3: You want to move a plan into SetWise quickly without manual setup

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: AI features require an internet connection.

importPlan.title: Import Plan (Parser)
importPlan.description: Import Plan lets you paste a workout plan and instantly convert it into a Program with Days (Templates).

pastePlan.title: 1) Paste your plan

list.2: Paste your plan into the text field

pastePlan.note: Larger plans may take up to a minute.

preview.title: 2) Preview what will be created
preview.description: After parsing, you’ll see a preview of the final result:
preview.imageAlt1: Preview header with Days / Exercises / Sets

list.1: Higher % = SetWise is more confident it interpreted the line correctly
list.2: Lower % = quickly double-check the exercise name and set targets

edit.title: 4) Edit before saving
edit.description: You can adjust the imported result directly in the preview:

chips.title: Edit targets via chips
chips.description: Tap a chip to edit values, for example:

instructions.title: Add exercise instructions (optional)
instructions.description: Use Instructions to store cues or setup notes for that exercise.

save.title: 5) Save templates
save.description: When you’re happy with the preview:
save.footer: Your program and days (templates) will be created and ready to start.

tips.title: Tips for best results

list.1: Keep each exercise on its own line
list.2: Include sets and rep ranges clearly (e.g. 3 x 8–10)
list.3: If you use notes like “drop set”, include them on the same line — you can verify in preview

tips.note: Note: Import works best with clearly formatted plans. If the preview looks significantly off even though your plan is written clearly, please contact support - it helps us improve the parser.

intro.description: The Profile tab is where you customize SetWise and manage your account. You can change appearance, language, training preferences, and send feedback.

list.4: Or use System / Automatic to follow your device setting

advancedAnalytics.title: Advanced Analytics
advancedAnalytics.description: If enabled, SetWise will show advanced training options like:
advancedAnalytics.footer: If you prefer a simpler experience, you can turn this off anytime.

autoAdvance.title: Auto-advance
autoAdvance.description:
When enabled, SetWise can automatically move to the next exercise after you finish the last set.

Turn it off if you prefer manual control.

support.title: Support — Send feedback
support.description: You can send feedback directly from the app.

account.title: Account
account.description: You can sign out anytime using Logout at the bottom of the Profile screen.

list.1: If you train in low light (or want the cleanest OLED look), try True Black.
list.2: If you don’t use tempo/ROM/intensifiers, turn off Advanced Analytics for a simpler workout view.
